result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. ZIPPERER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both. (fulltime in Summer and part time during school)
The Court orders expungement under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence.
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M. ZIPPERER

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 04-06-2016
Letter from Public Works Department indicating defendant has successfully completed 60 hours of community service at Peter's Pantry and Amvet's Picnic.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 04-06-2015 @ 11:00 a.m. BR-1.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 03-12-15 at 3:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $750.00 recognizance bond.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Shopko, on 12-23-14.
Initial appearance is set for 02-16-15 at 1:30 p.m.
